intro: Cambessedesia setacea, commonly known as the silky broom. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil, and belongs to the Malvaceae family. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems covered in soft, silky hairs. Its small, pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters and are typically found in moist, shaded environments. Cambessedesia setacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and delicate foliage.
